meanings.definition: A person who holds the philosophical view that universals or abstract concepts are mere names or labels without any independent existence.
meanings.sent1: The nominalists in the class debated the nature of abstract ideas.
meanings.sent2: Many nominalists believe that universals are just labels.
meanings.sent3: The nominalists jokingly argued that numbers are just imaginary friends.
meanings.sent4: In the world of nominalists, concepts are like shadows without substance.
meanings.sent5: The nominalists painted a picture of language as the creator of reality.

meanings.definition: Those who adhere to nominalism as a philosophical doctrine.
meanings.sent1: Nominalists often discuss the implications of their philosophical stance.
meanings.sent2: The group of nominalists gathered to study their shared doctrine.
meanings.sent3: At the conference, the nominalists playfully debated the essence of labels.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of ideas, nominalists stand firm like ancient pillars.
meanings.sent5: The nominalists' belief in nominalism shapes their entire worldview.
